Issues.Title: NgForm.hasError() does not return expected result when using more than one path
Issues.Body:
Angular : 7.0.0 Hi, I am writing angular code for form validation using template driven method. Both my typescript codes 
ngForm.hasError('required',['startId'])
ngForm.hasError('required',['numOfId'])
return true, which is as expected, since both my input fields with the name attribute startId and numOfId is empty. But when i do this 
ngForm.hasError('required',['startId','numOfId'])
it returns false. Is this a bug in the framework code? or did i have misunderstanding how the hasError 's path parameter works?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "NgForm.hasError() does not return expected result when using more than one path" (#28109)

Issues.Title: 'history.state' object is getting lost when navigate using back/forward buttons
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router.... ### Is this a regression? No ### Description I think there is a small bug - the `history.state` object is getting lost when navigate using back/forward buttons. The fix should be pretty simple- set the restored state into the `NavigationExtras` parameter in the call of `scheduleNavigation` in `Router.setUpLocationChangeListener()` method : ```javascript // Navigations coming from Angular router have a navigationId state property. When this // exists, restore the state. const state = change.state && change.state.navigationId ? change.state : null; setTimeout( () => { this.scheduleNavigation(rawUrlTree, source, state, {replaceUrl: true, state }); }, 0); ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction [https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-bupuzn](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-bupuzn) created by @fjauer - just use back/forward after pressing Test button ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Error reporting errors on angular.io
Issues.Body:
Something is causing our error reporting to Google Analytics to fail in certain cases. We should fix it so that we understand the unrelying error that we currently fail to report. See the number 1 error record:

```
Object expected TypeError: at e.prototype.reportError@main.14be4badac296faa979e.js:1:493477 
e.prototype.handleError@main.14be4badac296faa979e.js:1: | 15,925(6.42%)
```

The spike in error rate is not real - there were fewer errors in the last month because of lower traffic due to holidays.

![733e1c45-bf4c-4208-b606-5f0b0a9b8fe3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/216296/51078751-5c771600-166f-11e9-9e9d-bfb274e73879.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Error reporting errors on angular.io" (#28106)

Issues.Title: docs-infra: preview-server full
Issues.Body:
I was investigating `Cannot write: No space left on device` errors on `aio_preview` CircleCI job ([example][1]) and found out some interesting facts:

- The preview-server VM used an **100 GB** persistent disk to store build artifacts for previews.
- The dist was almost full (at **93 GB** used) and \~**7 GB** of build data had been recently deleted as part of our daily clean-up job (\~**25 PRs** @ **280 GB/PR**).
- There are currently build artifacts stored for **344 PRs** (note: each PR can have more than one previews; i.e. one preview per commit).
- Each commit is currently ~**70 MB** on disk (so we can "accomodate" a little less than **1500 commits** - or ~**375 PRs** with a mean of **4 commits/PR**).

##
_**I have resized the persistent disk to 200 GB, so we can "accomodate" double as many PRs now**_ :wink:

##
But the **70 MB/commit** caught my eye, so I dug further:

- **13 MB** come from `stats.json` (enabled in 764f471dc)
  > Disabling it (which is the default cli behavior) would allow us to "accomodate" ~**18 GB** more PRs.
  > (Is it really useful? I've never used it :grin:)
- **51 MB** come from `generated/`, of which:
  - **14 MB** come from `generated/images/` (not unexpected)
    > We could investigate whether there are more images that can be optimized (since #18243).
  - **33 MB** come from `generated/docs/`, of which:
    - **29 MB** come from `generated/docs/api/`.
      - Randomly looked at [HttpClient.json](https://next.angular.io/generated/docs/api/common/http/HttpClient.json) which accounts for ~**6 MB**(!)
        > - By replacing consecutive whitespace characters with a single space, the size was reduces to ~**300 KB**(!).
        > - Assuming other files are similar, applying the same change to all API docs, could reduce the overall size per commit by ~**30%** .
        > - More importantly, the API docs files will be much smaller and thus load faster (and take less space in the SW cache).

[1]: https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular/154785
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-infra: preview-server full" (#28105)

Issues.Title: Syntax error in Tour of Heroes example
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description I'm following along the Tour of Heroes tutorial and ran into an issue in Section 2: Displaying a List. Issues.Title: fix(ivy): debug node references not returning template ref
Issues.Body:
Fixes the `DebugNode.references` returning a reference to the underlying comment node, rather than the `TemplateRef` that the reference is pointing to. The issue comes from the fact that `discoverLocalRefs` falls back directly to returning the native node, if the ref isn't pointing to a directive, rather than looking through the locals.

These changes resolve FW-870.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): debug node references not returning template ref" (#28101)

Issues.Title: docs: update Google entity in all license headers
Issues.Body:
In #27880, we bumped the year and some entity labels from `Google Inc.` to `Google LLC`. But there are a _few_ more files that we need to update as well.

I've compiled that into a remote branch here: https://github.com/CaerusKaru/angular/tree/adam/entity. A simple diff shows that this amounts to **_3025_** files that need to be updated in angular/angular.

Although it might cause minimal disruption due to the nature of the diff, it's highly unlikely we want to do this all in one PR. So I'm opening this issue to track how we want to pull this off.

Some possibilities:
1. We do it on a file-by-file basis, like with `clang-format` fixes
2. We do it one package at a time, starting with the least-used/updated packages and working our way up
3. We do it all at once (not recommended)
4. We get Google to switch back to an `Inc.` just to save us the trouble üòÑ
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs: update Google entity in all license headers" (#28095)

Issues.Title: Union types cause error even though conditionally segregated with instanceof
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/forms I specifically can produce the issue in @angular/forms, but I believe the issue is more generally with the Typescript compiler ### Is this a regression? I do not believe so, or I do not know ### Description I have a variable defined by a union of multiple types. If I conditionally narrow down to one type in the code below, using instanceof, I see an error due to a type that I am not referencing in the if block. If I try to build using ng serve, the CLI compiler fails with the error below, although active editing only causes the error to show in the console while it states that it compiled successfully, as well as showing the error in my IDE. Here is the minimal code where the problem occurs: 

  @Input() parentForm: FormGroup | NgModelGroup | NgForm;
  @Input() options: {values: any};

  constructor(private fb: FormBuilder) {};

  ngOnInit() {
    if (this.parentForm instanceof NgModelGroup || this.parentForm instanceof NgForm) {

    } else if (this.parentForm instanceof FormGroup) {
      this.options.values.forEach(value => {
        this.parentForm.addControl(value.value, this.fb.control(""));
      });
    }
  }
I receive the error: 
Property 'addControl' does not exist on type 'FormGroup | NgModelGroup | NgForm'.
  Property 'addControl' does not exist on type 'NgModelGroup'.
According to the Typescript spec, I shouldn't even need an "else if". Just an "else" should work. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-f5s4m5?file=src%2Fapp%2Fhello.component.ts ## üî• Exception or Error 


error TS2339: Property 'addControl' does not exist on type 'FormGroup | NgModelGroup | NgForm'.
  Property 'addControl' does not exist on type 'NgModelGroup'.
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): support for multiple ICU expressions in the same i18n block
Issues.Body:
There were two issues with multiple ICU expressions in the same i18n block:
- the regexp that was used to parse the text wasn't able to handle multiple ICU expressions, I've replaced it with parsing the text and searching for brackets (which is what we ended up doing in the end anyway)
- we allocate node indexes for nodes generated by the ICU expressions which increases the expando value, but we would create the nodes for those cases during the update phase. In the mean time we would create some nodes during the creation phase (comment nodes for ICU expressions, text nodes, ...) with an auto increment index. This means that any node created after an ICU expression would get the following index value, but the ICU case nodes expected to use the same index as well... There was a mismatch between the auto generated index, and the expected index which was causing problems when we needed to select those nodes for updates later on. To fix it, I've added the expected node index to the list of mutate codes that we generate, and we do not use an auto increment value anymore.


FW-905 #resolve
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): support for multiple ICU expressions in the same i18n block" (#28083)

Issues.Title: Route Guards - Evaluation different from Documentation
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

Hi, I have a few problems with router guards. 
In the Documentation in section 'Routing & Navigation', Milestone 5, there's written: 

> You can have multiple guards at every level of a routing hierarchy. The router checks the CanDeactivate and CanActivateChild guards first, from the deepest child route to the top. Then it checks the CanActivate guards from the top down to the deepest child route.

I set a CanActivate and CanActivateChild to the same route node, I expected that the CanActivateChild guard was evaluate before than CanActivate, but it isn't.

Issues.Title: Datepipe on iOS 12.1.2
Issues.Body:
I want so show a date in angular date-pipe in an element. It works on windows and android perfectly, but not on any iOS device. ```

{{ gameStart | date:'short':'UTC+1':'de' }}

``` This is my error in console and the place were the date should been is empty: `InvalidPipeArgument: 'Unable to convert "Invalid Date" into a date' for pipe 't'` Is there a workaround or a solution for that problem?

Issues.Title: feat(@angular/cli): option to build and test only specified spec files
Issues.Body:
A new `--spec` option is added. It is a glob/pattern that specifies which specs should be included in the build. 

Command:
 `ng test --spec=app/services/auth*`

When karma is already running, selected spec can be updated by running following command: 
`ng test --spec=app/login* --spec-update`

Few rules are applied to the pattern to make certain things possible:
* `.spec.ts` is added automatically if missing (less typing)
* if it ends with `*.ts` and doesn't have `.spec.ts`, extension will be replaced with `.spec.ts`
* if path starts at root, source root directory will be trimmed. So that you could use relative file path from editor to make custom tasks to run the command


Behind the scenes a new `test.generated.ts` is saved next to original `test.ts` which instead of using `require.context` imports all matching files. This gives quite a big boost in the project at work (at least 10s on each iterative build!)

Fixes #3603

Motivation: It is a pain in a big application to wait until entire app is rebuilt just to run single `fit` block. Takes almost a minute with 4000+ tests and barely works when code coverage is enabled. 

Missing: docs(?)

Example tasks for vscode:
````
{
  // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
  // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
  "version": "2.0.0",
  "tasks": [
    {
      "type": "shell",
      "label": "test selected spec",
      "command": "node_modules/.bin/ng",
      "args": [
        "test",
        "--spec",
        "${relativeFile}"
      ],
      "problemMatcher": []
    },
    {
      "type": "shell",
      "label": "switch selected spec",
      "command": "node_modules/.bin/ng",
      "args": [
        "test",
        "--spec",
        "${relativeFile}",
        "--spec-update"
      ],
      "problemMatcher": [],
      "isBackground": true
    }
  ]
}
````

PS. The setup for writing tests is quite nice!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular/cli): option to build and test only specified spec files" (#13423)

Issues.Title: Dynamic component imports/declarations in prod builds
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ X] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ X] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
<!--
Output from: `node --version`, `npm --version` and `ng --version`.
  Windows (7/8/10). Linux (incl. distribution). macOS (El Capitan? Sierra? High Sierra?)
node: v10.14.2
npm: 6.4.1
@angular/cli: 7.1.4
-->


### Repro steps
Try to do your component imports for your module dynamically off a directory
```
import * as components from 'app/components';

const componentsArray = [];
Object.keys(components).forEach(name => componentsArray.push(components[name]));

@NgModule({
  declarations: [
    AppComponent,
    ...componentsArray
  ],
  imports: [
    BrowserModule,
  ],
  bootstrap: [
    AppComponent
  ]
})
export class AppModule { }
```

### The log given by the failure
<!-- Normally this include a stack trace and some more information. -->
ERROR in : Cannot determine the module for class SampleComponent in /.../projects/example/src/app/components/sample-component/sample.component.ts! Add SampleComponent to the NgModule to fix it.
Cannot determine the module for class OtherSampleComponent in /.../projects/example/src/app/components/other-sample/other-sample.component.ts! Add OtherSampleComponent to the NgModule to fix it.


### Desired functionality
When you have a project with a large count of components it can be a maintenance hazard to have a list of 100 imports. It's an easy step to forget when someone adds a new component, or renames them, or moves them to a different subdirectory. Using index.ts files you can get them all exported to a top-level directory, and then iterate over the import to get them all added to your module. This works fine for development but when I run a prod build it thinks I've never imported the components, even though they clearly are. As near as I can tell the only reason for this is that the names don't show up as an explicit import in the file itself.

I've done some console logging and confirmed that the output of this method is identical to if I just statically add them to the declarations array. There are no stray elements getting in, and every component is listed. 

I assume I'm missing some understanding of how the aot compilation handles index files and how that impacts this approach.


### Mention any other details that might be useful
This approach only seems to fail for components inside prod/aot builds. For non-prod/aot builds it works fine, for adding services to the module's providers it works, for importing ngrx effects it works.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dynamic component imports/declarations in prod builds" (#13416)

Issues.Title: dev-kit / dev-server doesn't properly check new fine-grained optimization build property
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```

- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
Angular CLI: 7.2.1
Node: 10.6.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.2.0

```
@angular-devkit/architect         0.12.1
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.12.1
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.12.1
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.12.1
@angular-devkit/core              7.2.1
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.2.1
@angular/cdk                      7.2.1
@angular/cli                      7.2.1
@ngtools/webpack                  7.2.1
@schematics/angular               7.2.1
@schematics/update                0.12.1
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.2.2
webpack                           4.23.1
```

### Repro steps
Create new project with ng new, then start with ng-serve

### The log given by the failure
The server starts with following warning:
```
****************************************************************************************
This is a simple server for use in testing or debugging Angular applications locally.
It hasn't been reviewed for security issues.

DON'T USE IT FOR PRODUCTION!
****************************************************************************************
```

### Desired functionality
This warning was not present in previous build, unless you've been running production builds (optimization: true)

### Mention any other details that might be useful
Relevant code in froom @dev-kit/(...)/dev-server/index.js

```
if (browserOptions.optimization) {
                this.context.logger.error(core_1.tags.stripIndents `
            ****************************************************************************************
            This is a simple server for use in testing or debugging Angular applications locally.
            It hasn't been reviewed for security issues.

            DON'T USE IT FOR PRODUCTION!
            ****************************************************************************************
`);
```

Since optimization is automatically translated to an object (from boolean) now, it will always be true. I believe the intent here was to only issue warning when someone is running ng-serve with production builds (?)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "dev-kit / dev-server doesn't properly check new fine-grained optimization build property" (#13415)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): Add progress reporters for webpack builds
Issues.Body:
- Add progress reporters for webpack builds. Previously only the default webpack progress handler was used. The default handler did not display well in all CI environments as it attempted to use the same console line for all progress updates.
- Add simple progress report, logging on new lines each time the build stage or build % changes.
- Add verbose progress report, logging on new lines on every progress update with additional data provided by webpack.
- Change default behaviour on non TTY consoles to use the simple progress report over the current behaviour of no progress reporting, this gives visibility over the status of build.

# Previews

## `default-webpack`
Delegate to default handler within ProgressPlugin in webpack (existing behaviour) 
![default-webpack](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4943487/50999097-53782e80-1521-11e9-9ec3-4e7588a3f973.gif)


## `simple-color`
Logging on new lines each time the build stage or build percentage changes (w/ colour)
![simple-color](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4943487/50999104-57a44c00-1521-11e9-911c-d01a6645b3e1.gif)

## `verbose-color`
Logging on new lines on every progress update with additional data provided by webpack (w colour)
![verbose-color](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4943487/50999111-5bd06980-1521-11e9-8ab7-7dd8e6169fbe.gif)

## `simple-plain`
Logging on new lines each time the build stage or build percentage changes (w/o colour)
![simple-plain](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4943487/50999116-5e32c380-1521-11e9-8c1f-dd3711729565.gif)

## `verbose-plain`
Logging on new lines on every progress update with additional data provided by webpack (w/o colour)
![verbose-plain](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4943487/50999123-60951d80-1521-11e9-9ae7-014471e77208.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): Add progress reporters for webpack builds" (#13405)

Issues.Title: Conditional ES5 Browser Polyfill Loading
Issues.Body:
- no need to manually import and manage individual ES2015 polyfills required by Angular
  - ES2015 polyfills are only loaded by browsers that require them
  - Controllable via a new `es5BrowserSupport` option; no behavior change if option is not enabled
  - `es5BrowserSupport` is enabled in newly generated projects
  - allows for custom polyfill solutions by not using the new option
  - works in conjunction with conditional JIT polyfills and will load ES2015 specific JIT polyfills as needed
  - Saves ~56KB on native ES2015 browsers
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Conditional ES5 Browser Polyfill Loading" (#13403)

Issues.Title: fix(tabs): unable to tab to tab content
Issues.Body: Currently the tab's content doesn't have a `tabindex` which means that if it doesn't have any focusable elements, users with assistive technology will skip over the content completely. These changes add a `tabindex` to the content of the currently-selected tab, based on [the example of accessible tabs from the ARIA best practices](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices-1.1/examples/tabs/tabs-2/tabs.html).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(tabs): unable to tab to tab content" (#14808)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): incorrectly sorting element inside dialog with blocked scrolling
Issues.Body:
We use the `ViewportRuler` to determine how much a page has been scrolled in order to compensate for it in some of the `ClientRect`-related calculations. This breaks down when the drop list is inside a dialog with blocked scrolling, because scroll blocking works by offsetting the `html` node which in turn throws off the `ViewportRuler`. These changes switches to reading the values off the `window` which won't be thrown off.

Fixes #14280.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): incorrectly sorting element inside dialog with blocked scrolling" (#14806)

Issues.Title: Dynamic change in label of mat-option gives ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Error should not occur for this scenario.

#### What is the current behavior?
Error: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked. Previous value: 'null:  '. Current value: 'null: Change to localized version'.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
**[StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qdpdx7)**

Essentially I mimicked a similar thing that I am seeing with this stackblitz.
In the real world we have pipe that goes to a service to retrieve a localized version of a string.
What happens is we call this pipe and it goes to a service that file does a http get for a json and finds a string that is in the proper language.

Our form field select is like so:
```
<mat-form-field>
  <mat-select
    id="clinicPrefReportsDropdown"
    class="select-reports"
    [disabled]="!isButtonEnabled"
    (selectionChange)="SelectReportsChanged($event)"
    [value]="SelectedReport"
  >
      <mat-option value="ClinicPreferredReports">{{
        'ClinicPreferredReports' | localize: localizationSection
      }}</mat-option>
       <mat-option value="MyPreferredReports">{{
        'MyPreferredReports' | localize: localizationSection
      }}</mat-option>
       <mat-option value="CustomReports">{{
          'CustomReports' | localize: localizationSection
      }}</mat-option>
  </mat-select>
</mat-form-field>
```

What happens is those labels start off as null and when the service comes back with the proper string it changes it and this is where the expressed changed error comes into play. So my stackblitz simulates this with having option1 as a variable in OnInit I put a setTimeout for 2 seconds to change the string and there error comes up.

I guess I am wondering if this is truly a bug or if I need to do something different to not allow this to happen. I did get this to work by manually calling a change detection after the localize variable we have gets populated (and take the pipe out of the equation) but this is a workaround to the problem I feel like.

Any thoughts?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dynamic change in label of mat-option gives ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError" (#14793)
